hero_section.title: Data Analytics Dashboards
hero_section.subtitle: Insights at Your Fingertips
hero_section.description: We design interactive dashboards that transform raw data into real-time insights, empowering smarter and faster decision-making across your business.

introduction_section.heading: What is
content: Data is only valuable if it’s understandable. Many businesses collect massive amounts of data but struggle to make sense of it. Manual reports are time-consuming, error-prone, and often outdated by the time they’re ready.

At Devisgon, we build custom data analytics dashboards that centralize your data, visualize trends, and deliver actionable insights in real-time. Our dashboards integrate seamlessly with CRMs, ERPs, marketing platforms, financial systems, and databases, giving you a single source of truth for your business.
From executive KPI dashboards to operational performance trackers, our dashboards are designed to be user-friendly, interactive, and decision-focused.

case_study_section.headline: 60 Hours Saved Monthly with Real-Time SaaS Analytics Dashboard

problem.label: Problem
problem.text: A SaaS company relied on manual Excel reports to track revenue, churn, and customer activity.

solution.label: Solution
solution.text: We built a real-time analytics dashboard integrating Stripe, HubSpot, and internal databases.

result.label: Result
result.text: Reporting became instant, saving ~60 hours/month and helping the leadership team react to trends immediately.

questions.question: Which tools can you automate?
questions.answer: Typically, an MVP can be developed in 4-6 weeks depending on the complexity of the features.

questions.question: Will automation replace my team?
questions.answer: Yes, we offer post-launch maintenance and support packages to ensure your application runs smoothly.

questions.question: How much time can automation save?
questions.answer: Absolutely. We specialize in integrating AI models into existing architectures via API.

questions.question: Do you create AI agents?
questions.answer: We primarily use Next.js, React, Node.js, Python, and cloud services like AWS or Vercel.
